General precautions:
1)Do not take any sleeping pills or sedatives before bed this helps in keeping the throat from relaxing too much. Eat healthy
2)Exercise frequently and maintain a healthy weight. Yoga is helpful in improving respiratory strength and can increase oxygen flow.
3)Quit smoking
4)Drink alcohol moderately, if at all, and don't drink several hours before bedtime.
5)Use a nasal decongestant or medications for allergy, acid reflux or chronic coughs if you are suffering with it.
6)Don’t sleep on your back. Sleep on your side or abdomen.
7)Avoid driving, if you are drowsy.
8)You can rub essential oils (like eucalyptus oils) on your chest before sleeping. (this precaution is generally observed to improve the condition, but it may vary for different individuals taking different allergies into consideration) Humidify your bedroom
